ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Ability to discuss social topics in Hindi, better vocabulary and grammar
I improved in my Hindi a lot! I also became more confident in speaking it freely. I also learned a bit about South Asian culture in the process.
I improved my skills at speaking, reading, and writing Hindi.
I learned more Hindi grammar and vocabulary. I also became more comfortable talking in class.
Continued to develop Hindi reading, writing, and speaking skills.
Acquired and practiced more Hindi grammar and vocab, and learned a bit about Indian culture

This courses developed my fluency in reading and writing Hindi. More so, it immersed me in Indian culture. My parents are both Indian immigrants, and I'd grown up in culturally Indian settings with many native Hindi speakers. As such, I had a very good intuition for Hindi going into this course. I'd hoped that taking this course would allow me to better connect with my cultural roots. By developing my Hindi and understanding of Indian culture and its traditions, I am grateful to say it did.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The structure and high student involvement in learning is great

Strengths - Mansi Ji is a great professor who truly cares about her students and their success. The class was very well organized and it was easy to see what things were required when. Also the small class size makes it so that you and your fellow Hindi classmates really bond throughout the semester. Weakness- My one weakness might be that it felt sometimes like there was an uneven course load, like some weeks we would have significantly more work than others. Mansi Ji was receptive to feedback about course load and difficulty though!

Strengths - It was a small course and there was a lot of personalized attention. The teacher could change the topics taught in the course to reflect our requests and what she thought we needed more help with.

Weaknesses - None.

Strengths: Mansi Ji always brought energy to class, small class gave everyone more chances to practice speaking, workload was always manageable, felt like we developed a sense of community, always appreciated the feedback on assignments.
Weaknesses: none really, though I think it's even possible to assign a bit more work, just to cover more and keep us practicing, even just a few sentences and even if it isn't possible to give feedback on every piece of homework.
The course was overall well taught and organized. There was some inconsistency with the workload and format of the course towards the beginning of the semester, but it was all figured out by the end.

I loved the amount of authentic sources we were exposed to -- real Hindi stories, media, songs; it was a very fun class because we had interesting discussions and debates; the only improvement I can see to make is to make the grammar exercises correspond a bit more to the topics we're discussing in class

Strengths: Mansi Ji was an exceptional lecturer. She was great at breaking concepts into digestible chunks. Above all, she was committed to making the activities/assignments fun. Likewise, she fostered a sense of community amongst classmates. I've never felt so close to my classmates as I did in this course.

Improvements: This class really drilled my ability to read, write, and comprehend Hindi. Although we often spoke in Hindi, I would have loved more opportunities to develop my speaking skills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes; it's a good and engaging class that bettered my Hindi skills

Yes! The Hindi department at Yale is really wonderful and truly because of the professors. You get to learn Hindi while also becoming very close with your class and professors. Hindi was easily my favorite class this semester.

I would recommend this course to another student, primarily because there is a lot of personal attention given to every students, and because (for South Asian students) it can be a nice way to reconnect to the culture in your home.

Yes. In my third semester of Hindi, I started feeling a sense of community with the class, and I felt I was getting better at understanding everyday conversation in the films we watched in class. The workload was always manageable, which was much appreciated.
I would recommend this course if you are interested in learning Hindi and learning about Indian culture.
This is one of the most exciting and engaging language classes I've taken at Yale; I learned so much Hindi but this class was never a source of stress

Yes. This course was an exceptional language course. The workload was very manageable, I now feel proficient in Hindi, Mansi Ji actively makes the class fun/engaging, and I really liked the sense of community amongst classmates. My parents are both Indian immigrants, and this course helped me feel closer to my cultural roots. Overall, great course and highly recommend.
